entityId.localType: National Library of Australia Bib ID

nameEntry.part: Forgotten Australians and Former Child Migrants oral history project [sound recording]

biogHist.abstract: The Forgotten Australians and Former Child Migrants oral history project is a collection of audio interviews with Forgotten Australians and Former Child Migrants. Interviewing commenced in 2009 and the project was officially launched in November 2012.
biogHist.p: Access conditions vary. A selection of the audio recordings are available online.
The digital master is held in the National Library of Australia, Oral History and Folklore collection, and a selection of the audio recordings are available online.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Report: Forgotten Australians : a report on Australians who experienced institutional or out-of-home care as children

bibref.name: Senate Community Affairs Reference Committee
bibref.title: Forgotten Australians : a report on Australians who experienced institutional or out-of-home care as children

archref.abstract: The Parliament of Australia issued a national apology to the Forgotten Australians on 16 November 2009. This is the apology delivered by then Prime Minister Kevin Rudd.
archref.note: Uploaded by NewsonABC to YouTube, 16 November 2009
